org.emerjoin.xmleasy

Class XMLEasy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.emerjoin.xmleasy.XMLEasy

  • public class XMLEasy
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the XMLEasy public API. Object instances of this class are not Thread-safe
    Author:
    Mario Junior

      • child

        public XMLEasy child(java.lang.String tag)
        Selects the first child element with a specific tag name.
        Parameters:
        tag - the child element tag name.
        Returns:
        an XMLEasy instance with the child Element set as current Element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current Element has no matching child element.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the tag name is null or empty.

      • validate

        public XMLEasy validate(java.net.URL schema)
        Validates the current XML Document against one XML Schema.
        Parameters:
        schema - the XML schema to validate the document
        Returns:
        the current XMLEasy instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the xml schema is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current XMLEasy instance was not created from a URL or an InputStream
        InvalidXMLDocumentException - if the XML document does not pass the XML Schema validation.

      • validate

        public XMLEasy validate(java.net.URL[] schemas)
        Validates the current XML Document against one or more XML Schemas.
        Parameters:
        schemas - the XML schemas array
        Returns:
        the current XMLEasy instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the xml schemas array is empty or null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current XMLEasy instance was not created from a URL or an InputStream
        InvalidXMLDocumentException - if the XML document does not pass the XML Schemas validation.

        Returns:

      • getElement

        public org.w3c.dom.Element getElement()
        Gets the current XML Element.
        Returns:
        the current XML Element. Will never return null.

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Gets the tag name of the current XML element.
        Returns:
        the tag name of the current XML element. Will never return null.

      • traverse

        public XMLEasy traverse()
        Activates the traversing mode. When traversing mode is ON, the single-child element navigation methods will perform navigation on the current XMLEasy instance. No new XMLEasy instance will be returned upon invocation of any of the previously referred methods. Are considered single-child elements navigation methods, the following: child(), child(String), firstChild(), firstChild(String), lastChild(String) and lastChild().
        Returns:
        the current XMLEasy instance.
